actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended).
Reported to House (Amended) by House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.  Report No: 97-274.
Placed on Private Calendar No: 25.
Called up by House on Call of Private Calendar.
Passed House (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.
Received in the Senate, read twice, and referred to the Committee on Commerce.
Committee on Commerce. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Commerce. Reported to Senate by Senator Packwood favorably with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Regular Orders. Calendar No. 407.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
House Agreed to Senate Amendments by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Private Law No: 97-12.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Navigation

official_title: A bill to direct the Secretary of the department in which the United States Coast Guard is operating to cause the vessel Capt. Tom to be documented as a vessel of the United States so as to be entitled to engage in the coastwise trade.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of the department in which the United States Coast Guard is operating to cause a named vessel to be documented as a vessel of the United States so as to be entitled to engage in the coastwise trade.

titles.title: A bill to direct the Secretary of the department in which the United States Coast Guard is operating to cause the vessel Capt. Tom to be documented as a vessel of the United States so as to be entitled to engage in the coastwise trade.
